alert.note: Alert for Gunnison; Montrose (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 5:13PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following counties, Gunnison and Montrose. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the west end of Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, northwest of Cimmaron. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Mesa Creek, Squaw Creek, Gunnison River, Loutsenhizer Arroyo, Cimarron River, Cottonwood Creek, Alkali Creek and Crystal Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cimmaron and Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
